meanings.definition: Hoseys (noun): A game in which players compete to be the first to call out 'hoseys' when spotting a specific object or action.
meanings.sent1: During recess, the children played hoseys to see who could spot the rainbow first.
meanings.sent2: In the hoseys game, everyone tried to be the quickest to shout 'hoseys' when a bird flew by.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic turned into a hoseys match as everyone raced to yell 'hoseys' at the sight of a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was filled with excitement as the students engaged in a hoseys battle over who could spot the teacher first.
meanings.sent5: The park echoed with laughter as the friends played hoseys, trying to be the first to call out 'hoseys' at the sight of a butterfly.

meanings.definition: Hoseys (verb): To quickly claim or call dibs on something before others can.
meanings.sent1: She hoseysed the last cookie before anyone else could grab it.
meanings.sent2: Whenever a new toy arrived, the siblings would hoseys it to avoid arguments.
meanings.sent3: He tried to hoseys the front seat in the car by jumping in before his sister could get there.
meanings.sent4: The determined shopper managed to hoseys the best deals during the sale.
meanings.sent5: The students would often hoseys the swings during recess, leading to playful competitions.
